answers.a: A type of reinforcement learning algorithm
answers.b: A type of supervised learning algorithm
answers.c: A type of unsupervised learning algorithm
answers.d: A type of deep learning algorithm

explanations.a: Q-learning is a model-free reinforcement learning algorithm that interacts with the environment and learns policy from it.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Q-value in Q-learning

answers.a: To measure the uncertainty of the agent's belief about the state of the environment
answers.b: To estimate the expected reward of taking a particular action in a particular state
answers.c: To represent the probability of observing a particular state given a set of actions

explanations.b: Q value for a particular state and action pair gives the expected reward on taking the action from that state

questions.question: What is the purpose of the epsilon-greedy policy in Q-learning?

answers.a: To converge the Q values quickly
answers.b: To ensure that the agent always takes the action with the highest Q-value
answers.c: To avoid getting stuck in local optima in the Q-value function
answers.d: To balance exploration and exploitation of the state-action space

explanations.d: Epsilon greedy approach allows exploration so as to learn a better policy

questions.question: Is Q-Learning an off policy method?

explanations.a: Q-Learning is an off policy method as it updates the Q values based on max value instead of current policy

questions.question: What is the ideal value of the discount factor in Q-learning to prioritize long-term rewards?

explanations.a: High value allows for future rewards to be considered as the effect of future rewards decreases exponentially
